member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Common.VGSerializationVersionningHelper
member.summary: This class is used to remember all fields that are not serialized/deserialized in a version of an object.
member.remarks: The console or runtime can managed multiple versions of a same classe. In a repository, you can save the version 1.1 on a class and read it with the version 1.0. In this case, if a new field exists in the version 1.1 but not in version 1.0, when the version 1.0 reads the version 1.1 it can keep the value event it does not use it. To do that, all fields should be serialized with the name "_e_NNN". the version 1.0 will read all item until the value _e_5 for example and will keep in memory the field _e_6 used in version 1.1. When the object is serialized the field will be automatically added to the serialization.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Common.VGSerializationVersionningHelper.GetUnreadSerializedValue(System.Int32,System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo)
member.summary: Extracts all unread fields from the specified SerializationInfo and returns the list of unread fields.
member.param: the index of the fields from which the fields should be kept.
the SerializationInfo from which the value of fields should be extracted.
member.returns: the list of unread fields.

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Common.VGSimpleEncryptor
member.summary: This class uses a symmetric key algorithm (Rijndael/AES) to encrypt and decrypt data. As long as encryption and decryption routines use the same parameters to generate the keys, the keys are guaranteed to be the same. The class uses static functions with duplicate code to make it easier to demonstrate encryption and decryption logic. In a real-life application, this may not be the most efficient way of handling encryption, so - as soon as you feel comfortable with it - you may want to redesign this class.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Common.VGSimpleEncryptor.Encrypt(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Encrypts specified plaintext using Rijndael symmetric key algorithm and returns the result.
member.param: Plaintext value to be encrypted.

Passphrase from which a pseudo-random password will be derived. The derived password will be used to generate the encryption key. Passphrase can be any string. In this example we assume that this passphrase is an ASCII string.
Salt value used along with passphrase to generate password. Salt can be any string. In this example we assume that salt is an ASCII string.
Hash algorithm used to generate password. Allowed values are: "MD5" and "SHA1". SHA1 hashes are a bit slower, but more secure than MD5 hashes.
Number of iterations used to generate password. One or two iterations should be enough.
Initialization vector (or IV). This value is required to encrypt the first block of plaintext data. For RijndaelManaged class IV must be exactly 16 ASCII characters long.
Size of encryption key in bits. Allowed values are: 128, 192, and 256. Longer keys are more secure than shorter keys.
member.returns: Encrypted value formatted as a string.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Common.VGSimpleEncryptor.Decrypt(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Decrypts specified ciphertext using Rijndael symmetric key algorithm.
member.param: ciphertext value.

Passphrase from which a pseudo-random password will be derived. The derived password will be used to generate the encryption key. Passphrase can be any string. In this example we assume that this passphrase is an ASCII string.
Salt value used along with passphrase to generate password. Salt can be any string. In this example we assume that salt is an ASCII string.
Hash algorithm used to generate password. Allowed values are: "MD5" and "SHA1". SHA1 hashes are a bit slower, but more secure than MD5 hashes.
Number of iterations used to generate password. One or two iterations should be enough.
Initialization vector (or IV). This value is required to encrypt the first block of plaintext data. For RijndaelManaged class IV must be exactly 16 ASCII characters long.
Size of encryption key in bits. Allowed values are: 128, 192, and 256. Longer keys are more secure than shorter keys.
member.returns: Decrypted string value.
member.remarks: Most of the logic in this function is similar to the Encrypt logic. In order for decryption to work, all parameters of this function - except cipherText value - must match the corresponding parameters of the Encrypt function which was called to generate the ciphertext.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of class.
member.param: A value specifying whether an existing repository can be overwritten.
The repository id of the application to deploy.
A boolean value indicating whether the roles of deployed application must be granted like the roles of previous version of this application.

A boolean value indicating whether all existing roles of the target repository must be kept. true if you want to keep the roles that exists in the target repository but not exists in the deployed repository, false if you want to delete all existing roles and replace them by the roles of the deployed repository.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Deployment.Actions.VGDeployApplicationAction.Overwrite
member.summary: Indicates whether the deployed application can overwrite an existing repository.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Deployment.Actions.VGDeployApplicationAction.AppRepositoryId
member.summary: Gets the repository id of the application to deploy

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Deployment.Actions.VGDeployApplicationAction.GrantRolesLikePreviousVersion
member.summary: Indicates whether the deployment process must grant roles of a new version of an application like roles of the previous version.
member.remarks:
This property will be ignored during the deployment process in 3 cases:
* The deployed application has not been created as a new version of another application.
* The deployed application already exists in the target repository (It is not the first deployment of the application).
* The previous version of the application (the application used to create this application) does not exist in the target repository.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Deployment.Actions.VGDeployApplicationAction.DeploymentMode
member.summary: Indicates the deployment mode used by the deployment process to deploys application items.
member.remarks:
The default value is equal to . When the is equal to , the deployment process will apply the following rules:
When an item exists in the deployed repository and the target repository, the deployment process will replace the target item by the deployed item.
When an item exists in the deployed repository but does not exist in the target repository, the deployment process will add the item of the deployed repository to the target repository.
When an item does not exist in the deployed repository but exists in the deployed repository, the deployment process will keep the item of the target repository.
when the is equal to , the deployment process will apply the following rules:
When an item exists in the deployed repository and the target repository, the deployment process will replace the target item by the deployed item.
When an item exists in the deployed repository but does not exist in the target repository, the deployment process will add the item of the deployed repository to the target repository.
When an item does not exist in the deployed repository but exists in the deployed repository, the deployment process will remove the item from the target repository.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Deployment.Actions.VGDeployApplicationAction.Import(Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Deployment.VGDeploymentImport)
member.summary: Deploys the repository defined in the deployment configuration file
member.param: A object that defines the deployment options.
member.exception: is null (Nothing in VB.Net).

The method must be called before calling this method.
- or - The option is set to and the target already contains an application with the same id.
- or - The option is set to and the target contains a repository with the same id and a version different from the application to deploy.
- or - The option is set to and the target contains a repository with the same id and a version newer than the version of the application to deploy.
- or - The option is set to and the target contains a repository with the same id and a version equal to or newer than the version of the application to deploy.
- or - The license of he target repository is expired or do not allow this version of Visual Guard.

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Deployment.Common.VGApplicationDeploymentMode
member.summary: Indicates how the deployment process will deploy an application.
member.remarks:
When the is equal to , the deployment process will apply the following rules:
When an item exists in the deployed repository and the target repository, the deployment process will replace the target item by the deployed item.
When an item exists in the deployed repository but does not exist in the target repository, the deployment process will add the item of the deployed repository to the target repository.
When an item does not exist in the deployed repository but exists in the deployed repository, the deployment process will keep the item of the target repository.
when the is equal to , the deployment process will apply the following rules:
When an item exists in the deployed repository and the target repository, the deployment process will replace the target item by the deployed item.
When an item exists in the deployed repository but does not exist in the target repository, the deployment process will add the item of the deployed repository to the target repository.
When an item does not exist in the deployed repository but exists in the deployed repository, the deployment process will remove the item from the target repository.

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Deployment.Common.VGApplicationDeploymentMode.Refresh
member.summary: The deployment process will replace all items of the target repository by the deployed items, add the new items

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Deployment.Common.VGApplicationDeploymentMode.Replace
member.summary: The deployment process will replace all items of the target repository by the deployed items, add the new items and remove target items that do not exist in the deployed repository.

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Deployment.Common.VGApplicationOverwriteOptions
member.summary: Indicates when an application can be overwritten

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Deployment.Common.VGApplicationOverwriteOptions.Never
member.summary: Disallows to overwrite an existing application

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Deployment.Common.VGApplicationOverwriteOptions.VersionIsEqual
member.summary: Allows to overwrite an existing application only when the version of the application to deploy is equal to the existing application.

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Deployment.Common.VGApplicationOverwriteOptions.VersionIsEqualOrNewer
member.summary: Allows to overwrite an existing application only when the version of the application to deploy is equal or newer than the version of the existing application

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Deployment.Common.VGApplicationOverwriteOptions.VersionIsNewer
member.summary: Allows to overwrite an existing application when the version of the application to deploy is newer than the version of the existing application

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Deployment.Common.VGApplicationOverwriteOptions.Always
member.summary: Always allows to overwrite an existing application even the version of the existing application is older than the version of the deployed application.

summary.para: Represents a managed wrapper over the DPAPI win32 apis.

member.remarks: This is a DPAPI wrapper. It is heavily based on the reference application on the Microsoft whitepaper at: http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/dnnetsec/html/SecNetHT07.asp?frame=true There have been some improvements, notably in the stricter cleanup of unmanaged global handles in Finally blocks.

summary.para: Encrypt given data; this overload can be used ONLY when storage mode is "User", since when storage mode is "Machine" we MUST have optional entropy to "salt" the phrase. This will throw an Invalid Operation Exception if used in Machine mode.

The hash value for which you want to compare the input to.

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Logging.VGLogEntry
member.summary: Represents a log message. Contains the common properties that are required for all log messages.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Logging.VGLogEntry.UserId
member.summary: The Visual Guard Id of the current user

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Logging.VGLogEntry.UserName
member.summary: The Visual Guard Name of the current user

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Logging.VGLogEntry.ApplicationId
member.summary: The Visual Guard Id of the application

member.summary: Name of the machine

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Logging.VGLogEntry.TimeStamp
member.summary: Date and time of the log entry message.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Logging.VGLogEntry.EventId
member.summary: Event identifier.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Logging.VGLogEntry.Severity
member.summary: Log entry severity as a enumeration. (Unspecified, Information, Warning or Error).

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Logging.VGLogEntry.Title
member.summary: Additional description of the log entry message.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Logging.VGLogEntry.Message
member.summary: Message body to log.
member.remarks:
You can use predefined values in your message. The list of predefined values is:
[eventid]The unique identifier of log entry.
[applicationid]The unique identifier of the application for which the log entry was generated.
[userid]The repository id of the current user.
[username]The name of the current user.
[timestamp]Date and time of the log entry message.
[machine]The Name of the computer.
[severity]Log entry severity as a enumeration
[tab]Insert a tab character in the body of a message.
[newline]Insert a newline character in the body of a message.
[p:XXX]represents the property with the name 'XXX' stored in the specified dictionary.

example.code: Dim dictionary as StringDictionary = new StringDictionary() dictionary.Add("myparam", "text of my param") Dim entry as VGLogEntry entry = new VGLogEntry("User Id:[userid]", "Application:[tab][applicationid][newline]My parameter:[tab][p:myparam][newline]Computer:[tab][machine]", TraceEventType.Information, dictionary) VGLogger.Write(entry)

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Logging.VGLogEntry.Properties
member.summary: Dictionary of key/value pairs that can be used as named properties in the message. this value can be null or empty.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Logging.VGLogEntry.UnnamedProperties
member.summary: An array of values that can be used as unnamed properties in the message. this value can be null or empty

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Logging.VGLogEntry.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of
member.param: the event identifier (>= 0 and < 10000)
the title of the message
the message body to log
member.exception: is less than zero or greater than 9999.
member.remarks:
You can use predefined values in your message. The list of predefined values is:
[eventid]The unique identifier of log entry.
[applicationid]The unique identifier of the application for which the log entry was generated.
[userid]The repository id of the current user.
[timestamp]Date and time of the log entry message.
[machine]The Name of the computer.
[severity]Log entry severity as a enumeration
[tab]Insert a tab character in the body of a message.
[newline]Insert a newline character in the body of a message.
[p:XXX]represents the property with the name 'XXX' stored in the specified dictionary.

example.code: Dim dictionary as StringDictionary = new StringDictionary() dictionary.Add("myparam", "text of my param") Dim entry as VGLogEntry entry = new VGLogEntry(1, "User Id:[userid]", "Application:[tab][applicationid][newline]My parameter:[tab][p:myparam][newline]Computer:[tab][machine]", TraceEventType.Information, dictionary) VGLogger.Write(entry)

the title of the message.
the message body to log
Log entry severity as a enumeration.
An array containing zero or more objects to format.
member.exception: is less than zero or greater than 9999.
member.remarks:
You can use predefined values or the specified unnamed properties in the body or the title of the message. If you want to use unnamed properties in your message, you just have to specified a format item like in method.
The list of predefined values is:
[eventid]The unique identifier of log entry.
[applicationid]The unique identifier of the application for which the log entry was generated.
[userid]The repository id of the current user.
[username]The name of the current user.
[timestamp]Date and time of the log entry message.
[machine]The Name of the computer.
[severity]Log entry severity as a enumeration
[tab]Insert a tab character in the body of a message.
[newline]Insert a newline character in the body of a message.
If you want to use unnamed properties in the body or in the title of your message, you can use the same syntax as the method. Each format item will be replaced (e.g: {0}) with the equivalent text of the value of a corresponding object specified in the array.

member.summary: This method will return the roles for provided VGApplications and for provided contextual groups. Case1. If applications list is empty, and contextual group is provided, It will return roles for all applications with provided contextual groups. Case2. If contextual group is empty, and applications list is provided, It will return roles for provided applications with all contextual groups. Case3. If application list is provided, and contextual group is provided, It will return roles for provided applications and provided contextual groups.
member.param: List of VGApplications
List of VGContextualGroups
member.returns: Roles for provided VGApplications and for provided contextual groups

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Membership.VGAuditingInstance.GetPermissions(Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Permission.VGIPermissionAuditSupported)
member.summary: This method returns permissions contained by VGIPermissionAuditSupported object. (VGMembershipUser, VGGroup, VGRole, VGPermissionSet) 1) permissions contained by user. (result will be a combination of user's permissions and user's groups' permissions, depending on authorization) 2) permissions contained by group. (result will be a combination of group's permission and ancestor groups' permissions, depending on authorization) 3) permissions contained by role. (result will be a combination of role's permission and role's permissionset's permission) 4) permissions contained by permissionset. (result will be a combination of permissionset's granted permissions and permissionset's sub permissionsets' granted permissions.)
member.param: VGIPermissionAuditSupported object which can be VGMembershipUser, VGGroup, VGRole, VGPermissionSet
member.returns: permissions contained by VGIPermissionAuditSupported object

target object(ex. VGMembershipUser, VGGroup, VGRole, VGPermissionSet, etc.)

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Membership.VGMembership
member.summary: Validates user credentials and manages user settings.
member.remarks:
This class is used by the applications to manage user settings. The Membership class provides the same facilities as the System.Web.Security.Membership class:
Creating new users.
Storing membership information (user names, passwords, e-mail addresses, and supporting data) in a Visual Guard repository.
Managing passwords, which includes creating, changing, retrieving, and resetting them, and so on. You can optionally configure the Visual Guard repository to require a password question and answer to authenticate password reset or retrieval requests for users that have forgotten their password.
This class can interact with class to manage user membership in roles for authorization checking.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Membership.VGMembership.GetUserNameByEmail(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a user name where the e-mail address for the user matches the specified e-mail address.
member.param: The e-mail address to search for.
member.returns: The user name where the e-mail address for the user matches the specified e-mail address. If no match is found, a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) is returned.
member.remarks: GetUserNameByEmail can be used to retrieve the user name for a membership user in the case where a user does not know their user name, but does know their e-mail address. If more than one user in the data store has the same e-mail address, the first user name encountered is returned. Leading and trailing spaces are trimmed from all parameter values.
member.exception: emailToMatch is null.
emailToMatch is empty or longer than 64 characters after trimming.

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Membership.VGMembershipInstance
member.summary: Validates user credentials and manages user settings for a specific security runtime.
member.remarks:
This class is used by WinForm application to manage user settings. The Membership class provides the same facilities as the System.Web.Security.Membership class:
Creating new users.
Storing membership information (user names, passwords, e-mail addresses, and supporting data) in a Visual Guard repository.
Managing passwords, which includes creating, changing, retrieving, and resetting them, and so on. You can optionally configure the Visual Guard repository to require a password question and answer to authenticate password reset or retrieval requests for users that have forgotten their password.
This class can interact with class to manage user membership in roles for authorization checking.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Membership.VGMembershipInstance.GetUserNameByEmail(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a user name where the e-mail address for the user matches the specified e-mail address.
member.param: The e-mail address to search for.
member.returns: The user name where the e-mail address for the user matches the specified e-mail address. If no match is found, a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) is returned.
member.remarks: GetUserNameByEmail can be used to retrieve the user name for a membership user in the case where a user does not know their user name, but does know their e-mail address. If more than one user in the data store has the same e-mail address, the first user name encountered is returned. Leading and trailing spaces are trimmed from all parameter values.
member.exception: emailToMatch is null.
emailToMatch is empty or longer than 64 characters after trimming.

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Membership.VGMembershipUser
member.summary: Exposes and updates membership user information in the Visual Guard repository.
member.remarks:
The object is used to represent a single membership user in the Visual Guard repository. It exposes information about the membership user such as the e-mail address, and provides functionality for the membership user such as the ability to reset his or her password.
A object is returned by the and methods or as part of a returned by the , , and methods.
A object is required by the method when you want to update the information for an existing membership user.

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Membership.VGRole
member.summary: Exposes and updates role information in the Visual Guard repository.
member.remarks:
The object is used to represent a role in the Visual Guard repository. It exposes information about the role such as the id, name, description and permission sets, and provides functionality for the role such as change the list of members.
A object is returned by the and methods or as part of a returned by the , methods.
A object is required by the method when you want to update the information for an existing role.

member.summary: Gets the a object with the specified name.
member.param: The name identifying the permission.
member.returns: A object with the specified id.

example.P: The following example gets the permission "Disable customer edition" contained in the folder "Customers" granted to the permission set "HR permissions".
example.code: VGSecurityManager.Principal.GetPermissionSet("HR permissions").GetPermission("\Customers\Disable customer edition")

member.remarks: This method does not look for permission in sub permission sets.

member.summary: Gets the a object with the specified id.

member.returns: A object with the specified id.

example.P: The following example gets the permission identified by the guid "5F0BAF21-A66C-4b27-9E9E-CCAE72226613" granted to the permission set "HR permissions".
example.code: VGSecurityManager.Principal.GetPermissionSet("HR permissions").GetPermission(new Guid("{5F0BAF21-A66C-4b27-9E9E-CCAE72226613}"))

member.remarks: This method does not look for permission in sub permission sets.

example.code: VGSecurityManager.Principal.GetPermissionSet("HR permissions").GetPermission(new Guid("{5F0BAF21-A66C-4b27-9E9E-CCAE72226613}"))

member.remarks: This method does not look for permission set in sub permission sets.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Role.VGPrincipal.HasPermission(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the specified permission is granted to the principal.
member.param: The full name of the permission, including the folder path.
member.returns: true if the principal has the permission, false otherwise

example.P: The following example checks if the permission "My permission" stored in the root of permissions.
example.code: If not VGSecurityManager.Principal.HasPermission("My permission") Then ' the permission is not granted ... End If
example.P: The following example checks if the permission "Disable Edition" contained in the folder "Customer" is granted to the current user.
example.code: VGSecurityManager.Principal.HasPermission("\Customers\Disable Edition")

member.remarks: this method is not case sensitive

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Role.VGPrincipal.HasPermission(System.Guid)
member.summary: Checks if the specified permission is granted to the principal.
member.param: The Visual Guard unique identifier of the permission
member.returns: true if the principal has the permission, false otherwise

example.P: The following example checks if the permission "{AEE3A747-05FB-4f90-BD3A-EF872E4D3211}" is granted to the current user.
example.code: If not VGSecurityManager.Principal.HasPermission(new Guid ("AEE3A747-05FB-4f90-BD3A-EF872E4D3211")) Then ' the permission is not granted ... End If
example.P: The following example checks if the permission "Disable Edition" contained in the folder "Customer" is granted to the current user.
example.code: VGSecurityManager.Principal.HasPermission("\Customers\Disable Edition")

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Scripting.Expressions.Collections.AbstractQueue
member.summary: This class provides skeletal implementations of some operations.

remarks.p:
The implementations in this class are appropriate when the base implementation does not allow elements. The methods , , and are based on the , , and methods respectively but throw exceptions instead of indicating failure via or returns.
An implementation that extends this class must minimally define a method which does not permit the insertion of elements, along with methods , and . Typically, additional methods will be overridden as well. If these requirements cannot be met, consider instead subclassing }.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Scripting.Expressions.Collections.AbstractQueue.AddAll(System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Adds all of the elements in the supplied to this queue.

remarks.p:
Attempts to
of a queue to itself result in . Further, the behavior of this operation is undefined if the specified collection is modified while the operation is in progress.

This implementation iterates over the specified collection, and adds each element returned by the iterator to this queue, in turn. An exception encountered while trying to add an element (including, in particular, a element) may result in only some of the elements having been successfully added when the associated exception is thrown.

member.param: The collection containing the elements to be added to this queue.
member.returns: if this queue changed as a result of the call.
member.exception: If the supplied or any one of its elements are .
If the collection is the current or the collection size is greater than the queue capacity.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Scripting.Expressions.Collections.AbstractQueue.Offer(System.Object)
member.summary: Inserts the specified element into this queue if it is possible to do so immediately without violating capacity restrictions.

remarks.p: When using a capacity-restricted queue, this method is generally preferable to , which can fail to insert an element only by throwing an exception.

member.param: The element to add.
member.returns: if the element was added to this queue.
member.exception: If the element cannot be added at this time due to capacity restrictions.
If the supplied is .
If some property of the supplied prevents it from being added to this queue.

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Scripting.Expressions.Collections.DictionarySet
member.summary: is an class that supports the creation of new types where the underlying data store is an instance.

remarks.p: You can use any object that implements the interface to hold set data. You can define your own, or you can use one of the objects provided in the framework. The type of you choose will affect both the performance and the behavior of the using it.
This object overrides the method, but not the method, because the class is mutable. Therefore, it is not safe to use as a key value in a dictionary.

To make a typed based on your own , simply derive a new class with a constructor that takes no parameters. Some implmentations cannot be defined with a default constructor. If this is the case for your class, you will need to override clone as well.
It is also standard practice that at least one of your constructors takes an or an as an argument.

member.summary: Implements an based on a hash table.

remarks.p: This will give the best lookup, add, and remove performance for very large data-sets, but iteration will occur in no particular order.

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Scripting.Expressions.Collections.HybridSet
member.summary: Implements an that automatically changes from a list based implementation to a hashtable based implementation when the size reaches a certain threshold.

remarks.p: This is good if you are unsure about whether you data-set will be tiny or huge.
remarks.note: Because this uses a dual implementation, iteration order is not guaranteed!

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Scripting.Expressions.Collections.ImmutableSet
member.summary: Implements an immutable (read-only) wrapper.

remarks.p: Although this class is advertised as immutable, it really isn't. Anyone with access to the wrapped can still change the data. So is not implemented for this , as is the case for all implementations in this library. This design decision was based on the efficiency of not having to clone the wrapped every time you wrap a mutable .

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Scripting.Expressions.Collections.IQueue
member.summary: A collection designed for holding elements prior to processing.

remarks.p: Besides basic operations, queues provide additional insertion, extraction, and inspection operations.

Each of these methods exists in two forms: one throws an exception if the operation fails, the other returns a special value (either or , depending on the operation). The latter form of the insert operation is designed specifically for use with capacity-restricted implementations; in most implementations, insert operations cannot fail.

Queues typically, but do not necessarily, order elements in a FIFO (first-in-first-out) manner. Among the exceptions are priority queues, which order elements according to a supplied comparator, or the elements' natural ordering, and LIFO queues (or stacks) which order the elements LIFO (last-in-first-out). Whatever the ordering used, the head of the queue is that element which would be removed by a call to or . In a FIFO queue, all new elements are inserted at the tail of the queue. Other kinds of queues may use different placement rules. Every implementation must specify its ordering properties.

The method inserts an element if possible, otherwise returning . This differs from the method, which can fail to add an element only by throwing an exception. The method is designed for use when failure is a normal, rather than exceptional occurrence, for example, in fixed-capacity (or "bounded" queues.

The methods remove and return the head of the queue. Exactly which element is removed from the queue is a function of the queue's ordering policy, which differs from implementation to implementation. The and methods differ only in their behavior when the queue is empty: the method throws an exception, while the method returns .
The and methods return, but do not remove, the head of the queue.
The interface does not define the blocking queue methods, which are common in concurrent programming.

implementations generally do not allow insertion of elements, although some implementations, such as a linked list, do not prohibit the insertion of . Even in the implementations that permit it, should not be inserted into a , as is also used as a special return value by the method to indicate that the queue contains no elements.

implementations generally do not define element-based versions of methods and , but instead inherit the identity based versions from the class object, because element-based equality is not always well-defined for queues with the same elements but different ordering properties.
Based on the back port of JCP JSR-166.

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Scripting.Expressions.Collections.ISet
member.summary: A collection that contains no duplicate elements.

remarks.p: This interface models the mathematical abstraction. The order of elements in a set is dependant on (a)the data-structure implementation, and (b)the implementation of the various methods, and thus is not guaranteed.

overrides the method to test for "equivalency": whether the two sets contain the same elements. The "==" and "!=" operators are not overridden by design, since it is often desirable to compare object references for equality.

Also, the method is not implemented on any of the set implementations, since none of them are truly immutable. This is by design, and it is the way almost all collections in the .NET framework function. So as a general rule, don't store collection objects inside instances. You would typically want to use a keyed instead.
None of the implementations in this library are guaranteed to be thread-safe in any way unless wrapped in a .
The following table summarizes the binary operators that are supported by the class.

item.term: Element included in result if it exists in either A OR B.
Element included in result if it exists in both A AND B.
Element included in result if it exists in one, but not both, of A and B.
Take all the elements in A. Now, if any of them exist in B, remove them. Note that unlike the other operators, A - B is not the same as B - A.

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Scripting.Expressions.Collections.PriorityQueue
member.summary:
An unbounded priority based on a priority heap. This queue orders elements according to an order specified at construction time, which is specified either according to their natural order (see , or according to a , depending on which constructor is used. A priority queue does not permit elements. A priority queue relying on natural ordering also does not permit insertion of non-comparable objects (doing so will result .
The head of this queue is the lowest element with respect to the specified ordering. If multiple elements are tied for lowest value, the head is one of those elements -- ties are broken arbitrarily.
A priority queue is unbounded, but has an internal capacity governing the size of an array used to store the elements on the queue. It is always at least as large as the queue size. As elements are added to a priority queue, its capacity grows automatically. The details of the growth policy are not specified.
This class and its enumerator implement all of the optional methods of the and interfaces. The enumerator provided in method is not guaranteed to traverse the elements of the PriorityQueue in any particular order.
Note that this implementation is NOT synchronized. Multiple threads should not access a instance concurrently if any of the threads modifies the list structurally. Instead, use the thread-safe PriorityBlockingQueue.

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Scripting.Expressions.Collections.PriorityQueue.PriorityQueueEnumerator._cursorIndex
member.summary: Index (into queue array) of element to be returned by subsequent call to next.

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Scripting.Expressions.Collections.PriorityQueue._queue
member.summary:
Priority queue represented as a balanced binary heap: the two children of queue[n] are queue[2*n] and queue[2*n + 1]. The priority queue is ordered by comparator, or by the elements' natural ordering, if comparator is null: For each node n in the heap and each descendant d of n, n <= d.
The element with the lowest value is in queue[1], assuming the queue is nonempty. (A one-based array is used in preference to the traditional zero-based array to simplify parent and child calculations.)
queue.length must be >= 2, even if size == 0.

member.summary: The number of elements in the priority queue.

member.summary: The comparator, or null if priority queue uses elements' natural ordering.

member.summary: The number of times this priority queue has been structurally modified.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Scripting.Expressions.Collections.PriorityQueue.fixUp(System.Int32)
member.summary: Establishes the heap invariant assuming the heap satisfies the invariant except possibly for the leaf-node indexed by k (which may have a nextExecutionTime less than its parent's).
member.remarks: This method functions by "promoting" queue[k] up the hierarchy (by swapping it with its parent) repeatedly until queue[k] is greater than or equal to its parent.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Scripting.Expressions.Collections.PriorityQueue.fixDown(System.Int32)
member.summary: Establishes the heap invariant (described above) in the subtree rooted at k, which is assumed to satisfy the heap invariant except possibly for node k itself (which may be greater than its children).
member.remarks: This method functions by "demoting" queue[k] down the hierarchy (by swapping it with its smaller child) repeatedly until queue[k] is less than or equal to its children.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Scripting.Expressions.Collections.PriorityQueue.removeAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes and returns element located at from queue. (Recall that the queue is one-based, so 1 <= i <= size.)
member.remarks: Normally this method leaves the elements at positions from 1 up to i-1, inclusive, untouched. Under these circumstances, it returns . Occasionally, in order to maintain the heap invariant, it must move the last element of the list to some index in the range [2, i-1], and move the element previously at position (i/2) to position i. Under these circumstances, this method returns the element that was previously at the end of the list and is now at some position between 2 and i-1 inclusive.

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Scripting.Expressions.Collections.SynchronizedHashtable
member.summary: Synchronized that, unlike hashtable created using method, synchronizes reads from the underlying hashtable in addition to writes.

remarks.p: In addition to synchronizing reads, this implementation also fixes IEnumerator/ICollection issue described at http://msdn.microsoft.com/netframework/programming/breakingchanges/runtime/clr.aspx (search for SynchronizedHashtable for issue description), by implementing interface explicitly, and returns thread safe enumerator implementations as well.
This class should be used whenever a truly synchronized is needed.

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Scripting.Expressions.Collections.SynchronizedSet
member.summary: Implements a thread-safe wrapper.

remarks.p: The implementation is extremely conservative, serializing critical sections to prevent possible deadlocks, and locking on everything. The one exception is for enumeration, which is inherently not thread-safe. For this, you have to lock the SyncRoot object for the duration of the enumeration.

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Scripting.Expressions.ExpressionEvaluator
member.summary: Utility class that enables easy expression evaluation.

remarks.p: This class allows users to get or set properties, execute methods, and evaluate logical and arithmetic expressions.

Methods in this class parse expression on every invocation. If you plan to reuse the same expression many times, you should prepare the expression once using the static method, and then call to evaluate it.
This can result in significant performance improvements as it avoids expression parsing and node resolution every time it is called.

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Scripting.Expressions.Util.DynamicCodeManager
member.summary: Use this class for obtaining instances for dynamic code generation.

remarks.p: The purpose of this class is to provide a simple abstraction for creating and managing dynamic assemblies.
remarks.note: Using this factory you can't define several modules within a single dynamic assembly - only a simple one2one relation between assembly/module is used.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Scripting.Expressions.Util.DynamicCodeManager.#ctor
member.summary: prevent instantiation

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Scripting.Expressions.Util.DynamicCodeManager.GetModuleBuilder(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the for the dynamic module within the specified assembly.
member.remarks:
If the assembly does not exist yet, it will be created.
This factory caches any dynamic assembly it creates - calling GetModule() twice with the same name will *not* create 2 distinct modules!
member.param: The assembly-name of the module to be returned
member.returns: the that can be used to define new types within the specified assembly

member.summary: Persists the specified dynamic assembly to the file-system
member.param: the name of the dynamic assembly to persist
member.remarks: Can only be called in DEBUG_DYNAMIC mode, per ConditionalAttribute rules.

member.summary: Copies all fields from one object to another.
member.remarks:
The types of both objects must be related. This means, that either of the following is true:
fromObject.GetType() == toObject.GetType()
fromObject.GetType() is derived from toObject.GetType()
toObject.GetType() is derived from fromObject.GetType()
member.param: The source object
The object, who's fields will be populated with values from the source object
member.exception: If the object's types are not related

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Scripting.Expressions.VGAST
member.summary: For internal purposes only. Use for expression node implementations.
member.remarks:
This class is only required to enable serialization of parsed Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.Scripting.Expressions expressions since antlr.CommonAST unfortunately is not marked as [Serializable].
Note:Since VGAST implements , deriving classes have to explicitely override if they need to persist additional data during serialization.

members.member:
Indicates the authentication mode used by Visual Guard to authenticate a user.
The authentication mode is used by the . You can also see the authentication mode supported by a repository by using the properties.

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationMode.None
member.summary: The repository does not support any authentication mode

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationMode.VisualGuard
member.summary: The repository supports authentication based on Visual Guard user

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationMode.Windows
member.summary: The repository supports authentication based on Windows Account
member.remarks: This authentication mode uses the specified Windows account to check authorization.

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationMode.Database
member.summary: The repository supports authentication based on Database Account
member.remarks: This authentication mode uses the database authentication process to authenticate a user. If the specified user cannot be connected to the database containing the Visual Guard repository the access to the application is denied.

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationMode.WindowsByCredential
member.summary: The repository supports authentication based on windows account

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationMode.Federation
member.summary: The repository supports authentication based on ADFS

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationMode.Custom
member.summary: The repository supports custom authentication

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationMode.All
member.summary: All authentication modes supported by Visual Guard

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationState
member.summary: Defines the state of an authentication process.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationState.#ctor(Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationStatus)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of .
member.param: The status of the authentication.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationState.Status
member.summary: Gets a corresponding to the authentication state.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationState.IsFailed
member.summary: Checks if the authentication process has failed
member.returns: true if the authentication process has failed. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationState.IsNotApproved
member.summary: Checks whether the user is not approved and cannot be authenticated.
member.returns: true if the user is not approved. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationState.IsCanceled
member.summary: Checks whether the authentication process has been canceled by the user.
member.returns: true if the authentication process has been canceled. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationState.IsCredentialInvalid
member.summary: Checks whether the authentication process has failed due to bad credentials (user or password incorrect).
member.returns: true if the user or the password is invalid. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationState.IsUserNotAuthorized
member.summary: Checks whether the user is not authorized to access to the application.
member.returns: true if the user is not authorized to access to the application. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationState.IsUserAccountExpired
member.summary: Checks whether the user account has expired.
member.returns: true if the user account has expired. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationState.IsUserAccountNotYetAvailable
member.summary: Checks whether the user account exists but is not yet available.
member.returns: true if the user account exists but is not yet available. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationState.IsUserAccountDisabled
member.summary: Checks whether user account is disabled.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationState.IsUserAccountLocked
member.summary: Checks whether user account is locked

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationState.IsLastBadLogin
member.summary: Checks whether the next bad logon attempt will lock out the user account.
member.returns: true if the next bad logon attempt will lock out the user account. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationState.IsLastGraceLogon
member.summary: Checks whether it is the last grace logon before locking out the account.
member.remarks: has been deprecated. When the password is expired and it is the last grace logon, Visual Guard no longer locks the account but sets the option 'MustChangedAtNexLogon' of the account and returns the status: | | .
member.returns: true if it is the last grace logon before locking out the account. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationState.IsPasswordExpired
member.summary: Checks whether the password is expired according to the password policy.
member.returns: true if the password has expired. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationState.IsPasswordSecure
member.summary: Checks whether the password is secure enough according to the password policy.
member.returns: true if the password is enough secure. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationState.IsUserAccountLockedOut
member.summary: Checks whether the user account is locked out due to bad credentials.
member.returns: true if the user account is locked out. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationState.IsUserAccountWillBeLockedOut
member.summary: Checks whether the user account will be locked out for the next logon attempt.
member.returns: true if the user account will be locked out. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationState.MustChangePasswordAtNextLogon
member.summary: Checks whether the user must change the password at next logon.
member.returns: true if the user must change the password at next logon. false otherwise.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationState.ToString
member.summary: Convert the state to a string value.
member.returns: the state as a string value.

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationStatus
member.summary: Defines all the authentication status

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationStatus.Failure
member.summary: The authentication fails.

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationStatus.UserNotFound
member.summary: The authentication fails. The user is not found in the repository

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationStatus.PasswordIsLocked
member.summary: The authentication fails. The password is locked and must be unlocked by an administrator

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationStatus.PasswordDoesNotMatch
member.summary: The authentication fails. The password does not match the password stored in the repository.

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationStatus.UserNotAuthorized
member.summary: The authentication fails. The user does not have any granted role for the application.

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationStatus.UserAccountExpired
member.summary: The authentication fails. The user account is expired.

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationStatus.UserAccountNotYetAvailable
member.summary: The authentication fails. The user account is not yet available.

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationStatus.ProcessCanceled
member.summary: The authentication fails. The logon process has been canceled by the user.

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationStatus.NotApproved
member.summary: The authentication fails. The credential is not approved and cannot be authenticated.

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationStatus.MustChangePasswordAtNextLogon
member.summary: The authentication fails. The password must be changed during the logon process. You must call the method before attempting to authenticate the user.
member.remarks: This value can be combined with or when the password does not complies with the Password Policy and it is last grace logon.

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationStatus.LastBadLogin
member.summary: The authentication fails. The password does not match the password stored in the repository and if the next login attempt fails the account will be locked.

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationStatus.Success
member.summary: The authentication succeeds.

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationStatus.LastGraceLogon
member.summary: LastGraceLogon has been deprecated. The authentication succeeds but the password is expired and it is the last grace logon. If the password is not changed before next login attempt, the password will be locked.
member.remarks: is deprecated. When the password is expired and it is the last grace logon, Visual Guard sets the option 'MustChangedAtNexLogon' and returns the status: | | .

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationStatus.PasswordExpired
member.summary: The authentication succeeds if it is not the last grace logon or fails otherwise. The password is expired and must be changed.

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationStatus.PasswordDoesNotPassValidation
member.summary: The authentication succeeds if it is not the last grace logon or fails otherwise. The password does not pass the validation according to the password policy and must be changed

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationStatus.PasswordWillBeLocked
member.summary: The authentication fails. The password will be locked for the next login attempt.

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationStatus.UserNotFoundInCustomStorage
member.summary: The authentication fails. User does not exist in Custom identity module storage

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationStatus.UserAccountDisabled
member.summary: The authentication fails. User is disabled

member.name: F:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGAuthenticationStatus.UserAccountLocked
member.summary: The authentication fails. User account is locked

member.value: the unique Visual Guard identifier of the original permission when the permission is a new version of another permission. When the permission is the original permission, the value is equal to .

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGIPermissionAttribute
member.summary: Represents an attribute (argument) of a object.
member.remarks: This attribute can be defined at design time by using the Visual Guard console. To edit the attributes list, you must use the menu option 'Action>Edit arguments list' when the permission is selected.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGIPermissionAttribute.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the attribute.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGIPermissionAttribute.Description
member.summary: Gets the description of the attribute.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGIPermissionAttribute.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the attribute.

example.p: This example modify the argument Country of the permission '\Common\Display only information on a country'
example.code: Dim PermId As Guid = New Guid("975d80d8-b23f-4226-8cc8-ce2965e59e8c") ' Id of the permission "\Common\Display only information on a country" ' Checks if the permission is granted to the current user and gets the argument value assign to this permission If Not VGSecurityManager.Principal.HasPermission(PermId) Then MessageBox.Show("The permssion '\Common\Display only information on a country' is not granted to the current user") Else Dim myPerm As VGIPermission = VGSecurityManager.Principal.GetPermission(PermId) Dim attr As VGIPermissionAttribute = myPerm.Attributes.GetAttributeByName("Country") attr.Value = "France" MessageBox.Show("The current user can now see information about the country 'France'") End If

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGIPermissionSet.GetPermission(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the a object with the specified name.
member.param: The name identifying the permission.
member.returns: A object with the specified id.

example.P: The following example gets the permission "Disable customer edition" contained in the folder "Customers" granted to the permission set "HR permissions".
example.code: VGSecurityManager.Principal.GetPermissionSet("HR permissions").GetPermission("\Customers\Disable customer edition")

member.remarks: This method does not look for permission in sub permission sets.

example.code: VGSecurityManager.Principal.GetPermissionSet("HR permissions").GetPermission(new Guid("{5F0BAF21-A66C-4b27-9E9E-CCAE72226613}"))

member.remarks: This method does not look for permission in sub permission sets.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGIPrincipal.GetPermission(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the specified object.
member.param: The full name of the permission, including the folder path.
member.returns: The specified object if the permission is granted to the principal. Returns null (Nothing in VB) if the permission is not granted or it does not exist.

example.P: The following example gets the permission "My permission" stored in the root of permissions.
example.code: Dim myPerm as VGIPermission = VGSecurityManager.Principal.GetPermission("My permission") If myPerm is Nothing Then ' the permission is not granted ... Else Dim myValue as String = CType(myPerm(myValue), String) End If
example.P: The following example gets the permission "Disable Edition" contained in the folder "Customer".
example.code: VGSecurityManager.Principal.GetPermission(@"\Customers\Disable Edition")

member.remarks: this method is not case sensitive

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGIPrincipal.HasPermission(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether the specified permission is granted to the principal.

member.returns: true if the principal has the permission, false otherwise

example.P: The following example checks whether the permission "My permission" stored in the root of permissions is granted to the current user.
example.code: If not VGSecurityManager.Principal.HasPermission("My permission") Then ' the permission is not granted ... End If
example.P: The following example checks whether the permission "Disable Edition" contained in the folder "Customer" is granted to the current user.
example.code: VGSecurityManager.Principal.HasPermission(@"\Customers\Disable Edition")

member.remarks: this method is not case sensitive

example.P: The following example checks whether the permission "{AEE3A747-05FB-4f90-BD3A-EF872E4D3211}" is granted to the current user.
example.code: If not VGSecurityManager.Principal.HasPermission(new Guid ("AEE3A747-05FB-4f90-BD3A-EF872E4D3211")) Then ' the permission is not granted ... End If

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGIPrincipal.MembershipPermission
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the current user can use Membership API to edit, create, delete or assign role to users for the current application
member.value: When the Membership Permissions are disabled, the value is always . When Membership Permssions are enabled, if the user is member of the 'Membership Manager' role, this property is equal to , otherwise the property is equal to
member.remarks:
This property allows to check whether the user can use Membership API. .
You can enabled Membership permissions by using the Visual Guard console and setting the property "Membership Permissions Enabled" to true for the application.

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGISecurable
member.summary: Provides an interface for classes that need to be secured by Visual Guard.
member.remarks:
If you add this interface to a class, this class will be visible at design time in the Visual Guard Console. By default Visual Guard automatically intercepts Forms creation and sets the security. The automatic interception is disabled for classes implementing this interface (like Form, Page, MasterPage).
For more information, see How Visual Guard secures an application

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGPrincipalPermission
member.summary: Allows checks against the current principal (see ) using the language constructs defined for both declarative and imperative security actions.
member.remarks: This class can be used in place of the class and allows to check whether a Visual Guard permission or role is granted to the current Visual Guard principal.
member.seealso: How to apply security in your application

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGPrincipalPermission.#ctor(System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified .
member.param: One of the values.
member.exception: The state parameter is not a valid .

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGPrincipalPermission.IsUnrestricted
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the current permission is unrestricted.
member.returns: true if the current permission is unrestricted; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGPrincipalPermission.#ctor(System.String,Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGPermissionType)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for the specified role or permission.
member.param: The name of the role or the fullname of the permission for which to check membership. This value is not case sensitive.
the type of the item to check (role or permission)
member.remarks:
When the user is not authenticated the permission will throw a security exception.
If you want to check a permission, you have to use the full name of the permission. When the permission is stored in the root permission folder, the full name of the permission is equal to the permisison name. When the permission is stored in a sub permission folder, the full name is equal to "\<sub folder name>\<\...\permission name name>".
For example the full name of the "Disallow to administrate customers" permission stored in the "Customers" folder is equal to "\Customers\Disallow to administrate customers" .

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGPrincipalPermission.#ctor(System.String,Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGPermissionType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for the specified role or permission.
member.param: The name of the role or the fullname of the permission for which to check membership. This value is not case sensitive.
the type of the item to check (role or permission)
true to signify that the user is authenticated; otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
When is equal to false, is ignored.
If you want to check a permission, you have to use the full name of the permission. When the permission is stored in the root permission folder, the full name of the permission is equal to the permission name. When the permission is stored in a sub permission folder, the full name is equal to "\<sub folder name>\<\...\permission name name>".
For example the full name of the "Disallow to administrate customers" permission stored in the "Customers" folder is equal to "\Customers\Disallow to administrate customers" .

the type of the item to check (role or permission)
member.remarks: When the current principal is null or not authenticated the permission will throw a security exception.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGPrincipalPermissionAttribute.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the fullname of the permission or the name of the role.
member.value:
The fullname of the Visual Guard permission, including the folder path
- or - the name of the role.
member.remarks:
When is equal to false, the name is ignored.
If you want to check a permission, you have to use the full name of the permission. When the permission is stored in the root permission folder, the full name of the permission is equal to the permission name. When the permission is stored in a sub permission folder, the full name is equal to "\<sub folder name>\<\...\permission name name>".
For example the full name of the "Disallow to administrate customers" permission stored in the "Customers" folder is equal to "\Customers\Disallow to administrate customers" .

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityManager
member.summary: Provides the main access point for classes interacting with the Visual Guard security system. This class cannot be inherited.
member.remarks: class allows to access to the default Visual Guard runtime environment. If you need to use more than one environment in a same application domain, you can use the class.

member.name: E:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityManager.DefaultRuntimeInitialized
member.summary: Occurs when the object assigned by default to the security manager is initialized.
member.remarks:
The event handler receives an argument of type containing data related to this event. The event allows to change the default security settings used by Visual Guard to load the security from the repository and set the security on the objects of the application.
For ASP.Net application using the VGHttpModule module to manage the security, the object defined in this event is not used. You should use the VGHttpModule.Initialized event if you want to change the default security settings.

member.name: E:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityManager.LogWriting
member.summary: Occurs before a log entries is written in a repository.
member.remarks: The event handler receives an argument of type containing data related to this event. The LogWriting event allows altering or filtering events that will be written in a repository.

member.name: E:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityManager.SignedOut
member.summary: Occurs when the current user is signed out.
member.remarks: The event handler receives an argument of type containing data related to this event. The SignedOut event allows executing an action after each call of the method.

member.name: E:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityManager.ValidatingPassword
member.summary: Occurs when a password is changed or is reset.
member.remarks: The event handler receives an argument of type containing data related to this event. The ValidatingPassword event allows to cancel the password modification when the password is not valid.

member.name: E:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityManager.PermissionsLoading
member.summary: Occurs before the permissions are loaded and allows filtering the list of user's roles.
member.remarks: The event handler receives an argument of type containing data related to this event. The PermissionsLoading event allows a user to filter the list of roles granted to the principal or to cancel the authorization (or authentication) process.

member.name: E:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityManager.GroupsLoading
member.summary: Occurs before the permissions are loaded and allows filtering the list of user's groups for contextual group selection.
member.remarks: The event handler receives an argument of type containing data related to this event. The GroupSelectionLoading event allows a user to filter the list of user's groups for contextual group selection.

member.name: E:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityManager.CheckVersion
member.summary: Allows to check if the version of the repository permissions is compatible with the version of the application.
member.remarks: Occurs after the authentication and before loading permissions.

member.name: E:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityManager.SecurityLoaded
member.summary: Occurs after the security permissions are loaded.
member.remarks: The event handler receives an argument of type containing data related to this event. The SecurityLoaded event allows executing an action after each call of the or method.

member.name: E:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityManager.SecurityError
member.summary: Occurs when Visual Guard loads security actions and a type are unknown or when Visual Guard sets the security of an object and an exception occurs.
member.remarks: The event handler receives an argument of type containing data related to this event. The SecurityError event allows a user to determine whether or not the operation should continue after the error occurs.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityManager.LoadSecurity
member.summary: Loads the permission of the identity.
member.returns: A representing the state of the authorization
member.remarks: If a user has more than one role in the application, you can use the event to allow the user to select a role in the granted roles list. By default, Visual Guard will create permission set that will be a union of all permision sets granted to the roles.
member.exception:
The configuration file is not valid
or A problem occurs during the connection to the repository.
or The version of the repository or the version of the permissions is not supported by the application.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityManager.LoadSecurity(System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity)
member.summary: Loads the permission of the given IIdentity.
member.param: a object representing the user.
member.returns: A representing the state of the authorization

example.code: Dim state As VGAuthorizationState state = VGSecurityManager.LoadSecurity (System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity.GetCurrent()) If state.IsFailed Then If state.IsUserNotFound Then MessageBox.Show("Your are not declared in the security repository") ElseIf state.IsUserNotAuthorized Then MessageBox.Show("Your are not authorized to log on to this application") End If Else Application.Run(New MDIForm) End If

member.remarks: If a user has more than one role in the application, you can use the event to allow the user to select a role in the granted roles list. By default, Visual Guard will create permission set that will be a union of all permision sets granted to the roles.
member.exception:
The configuration file is not valid
or A problem occurs during the connection to the repository.
or The version of the repository or the version of the permissions is not supported by the application.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityManager.LoadSecurity(System.String)
member.summary: Loads the permissions of a user identified by the user name.
member.param: the name of the user.
member.returns: A representing the state of the authorization

example.code: Dim state As VGAuthorizationState state = VGSecurityManager.LoadSecurity ("myUserName") If state.IsFailed Then If state.IsUserNotFound Then MessageBox.Show("Your are not declared in the security repository") ElseIf state.IsUserNotAuthorized Then MessageBox.Show("Your are not authorized to log on to this application") End If Else Application.Run(New MDIForm) End If

member.remarks:
If a user has more than one role in the application, you can use the event to allow the user to select a role in the granted roles list. By default, Visual Guard will create permission set that will be a union of all permision sets granted to the roles.
This method check authorization only for Visual Guard user, do not use this method for database or Windows user

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the principal of the current thread () must be replaced by the Visual Guard principal after an authentication.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityManager.ConfigurationFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the path of the Visual Guard configuration file.
member.remarks:
By default, the Visual Guard configuration file is named VisualGuardConfiguration.exe.config and is located in the same directory as the Novalys.VisualGuard.Security assembly. This property must be set before calling the other methods of .
Click here for more information about Visual Guard configuration files, see "How to generate or edit the Visual Guard configuration files"

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityManager.SetSecurity(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the security for the specified object.
member.param: The object for which you want to set the security

remarks.P: You need to call this method only once for each object instance.

In most of case, this method must be called at the end of constructor of the object (after the call of InitializeComponent method for components). This method registers the object in Visual Guard then it executes the actions defined for this target to be executed when the security is loaded.
If some actions must be executed on other events, It handles these events. The actions associated to these events will be executed each time the events are raised.
remarks.b: For more information, you can consult:

para.A: How Visual Guard secures an application
How to apply security in your application

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityManager.LoadAnomymousSecurity
member.summary: Loads the permissions for an anonymous session.
member.remarks:
The application supports the anonymous session when a role is specified as anonymous role for your applcation and the option anonymousSessionSupported of your Visual Guard configuration file is equal to true.
To define an anonymous role, you must be connected to the repository with the Visual Guard console and modify the property Anonymous Role of your application.
After modifying this property, you have to regenerate the Visual Guard configuration file of your application or edit it to modify the option anonymousSessionSupported.
member.exception: The application does not allowed anonymous session or the role granted to the anonymous session is not valid.

The configuration file is not valid
or A problem occurs during the connection to the repository.
or The version of the repository or the version of the permissions is not supported by the application.

member.summary: Loads the permission for an anonymous session associated to the specified windows identity
member.param: the identity for which an anonymous session is loaded.
member.remarks:
The application supports the anonymous session when a role is specified as anonymous role for your applcation and the option anonymousSessionSupported of your Visual Guard configuration file is equal to true.
To define an anonymous role, you must be connected to the repository with the Visual Guard console and modify the property Anonymous Role of your application.
After modifying this property, you have to regenerate the Visual Guard configuration file of your application or edit it to modify the option anonymousSessionSupported.
member.exception: The application does not allowed anonymous session or the role granted to the anonymous session is not valid.

The configuration file is not valid
or A problem occurs during the connection to the repository.
or The version of the repository or the version of the permissions is not supported by the application.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityManager.IsAnonymousSessionSupported
member.summary: Indicates whether an anonymous sessions are supported by the current application.
member.returns: true if an anonymous role is defined for the application, false otherwise.
member.remarks:
The application supports the anonymous session when a role is specified as anonymous role for your applcation and the option anonymousSessionSupported of your Visual Guard configuration file is equal to true.
To define an anonymous role, you must be connected to the repository with the Visual Guard console and modify the property Anonymous Role of your application.
After modifying this property, you have to regenerate the Visual Guard configuration file of your application or edit it to modify the option anonymousSessionSupported.
member.exception:

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityManager.UpdateCredentialStatistics
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating if the statistics of credential must be updated or not.
member.value: true if you want to update credential statistics, false otherwise. The default value is true.
member.remarks:
By default, Visual Guard updates statistic information of credential after each authentication attempt.
These statistics (time of last access, number of grace logon used, time of last password modification, password history...) are stored in the repository of the application. If you do not use a password policy based on password or logon failed history, it is possible to disable this update by using this property. In this case, the performance of each authentication will be increased.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityManager.TraceLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the level of the Visual Guard trace.
member.remarks:
This trace level specifies to Visual Guard what messages to trace. By default, the level is TraceLevel.Info when a debugger is attached to the application and TraceLevel.Off otherwise. You can also set the trace level by configuring a "VisualGuard" in your application configuration file.
: Visual Guard does not generate trace. : Visual Guard will trace only error messages. : Visual Guard will trace error messages, Initialization information, Authentication or authorization or password modification status. : Visual Guard will trace error messages, Initialization information, Authentication or authorization or password modification status, information about permission sets and Security actions. : All messages. You can use this option to trace information when a problem occurs and send this trace to the support for helping us to resolve the problem.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityManager.TraceListener
member.summary: Gets or sets the object used to trace Visual Guard messages.
member.value: If the value is null (Nothing), the Visual Guard messages will be only traced in the listeners attached to the . if the value is not null, the Visual Guard messages will be traced in the given listener and in the listeners attached to the .
member.remarks: By default, if the trace is enabled, Visual Guard will trace its messages in the VGTRaceOut.txt file.
