member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityManager.CheckContext(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Check if the context of Visual Guard is valid.
member.param: throw an error if the context is not valid
member.returns: true if the Visual Guard context is valid, false otherwise.
member.remarks: You can call this method if you want to check if the context of Visual Guard is valid for the application. If you do not call this method, Visual Guard will check this information at the first call of the repository and will throw an exception at this time. The method will check if Visual Guard configuration files are valid and if it is possible to access to the repository and if the application has enough permissions on this repository.
member.exception: This exception will be thrown if the application cannot access to the repository.
This exception will be thrown if Visual Guard configuration files are not available or if the parameters of these files are not valid.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityManager.SetSecurity(System.Object,System.Type)
member.summary: Sets the security corresponding to the specified type for the specified object.
member.param: The object for which you want to set the security
a object specifying the type for which the actions are targeted. This type must be assignable from the type of the specified object.

remarks.P: You need to call this method only once for each object instance.

In most of case, this method must be called at the end of constructor of the object (after the call of InitializeComponent method for components). This method registers the object in Visual Guard then it executes the actions defined for this target to be executed when the security is loaded.
If some actions must be executed on other events, It handles these events. The actions associated to these events will be executed each time the events are raised.
You can use this method when you define actions for an ancestor class. By default Visual Guard sets the security only for the type of the object and not for its ancestor.
remarks.b: For more information, you can consult:

para.A: How Visual Guard secures an application
How to apply security in your application

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityManager.AllowAutomaticInterception
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether Visual Guard can use its automatic interception mechanism to intercept the instantication of Forms and automatically set the security to this instance.
member.remarks:
By default, Visual Guard will intercept automatically the instanciation of class for which Visual Guard must apply security action. This interception is available only on classes derived from System.Windows.Forms.Form form WinForm application and System.Web.UI.Page or System.Web.UI.MasterPage for Web application.
This property must be set before loading the security of the user.
When this option is set to false, You have to call the method for all secured objects.
Automatic Interception in WinForm context requires for operating whith infrastructure code and configuration of the remoting infrastructure. If you do not want to grant this permission to your application , you should set this option to false and call method for each secured class.
For more information, see How Visual Guard secures an application
member.exception: Unable to unload automatic interception. Some classes are already registered for interception. This method cannot be called after the security is loaded for a user and some security actions require automatic interception.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityManager.IncludeWindowsGroups
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether role granted to Windows Groups are included to the list of role of a user.
member.returns: true if Windows groups are included; otherwise, false. The default is true.
member.remarks: if the Windows groups are not required, setting this property to false can improve performance by avoiding to load role granted to Windows group.

member.name: T:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityRuntime
member.summary: Provides the main access point for classes interacting with the Visual Guard security system. This class cannot be inherited.
member.remarks:
This class provides the same features as and must be used when you want to manage more than one Visual Guard environment in a same application domain.
For example, you can create 2 instances of class to access to 2 differents repository from your application or when you want to load the security of 2 different users in the same time (in server environment for example).
When you create a new instance of class based on an other instance, Visual Guard will share its cache between the 2 instances.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityRuntime.SetSecurity(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the security for the specified object.
member.param: The object for which you want to set the security

remarks.P: You need to call this method only once for each object instance.

In most of case, this method must be called at the end of constructor of the object (after the call of InitializeComponent method for components). This method registers the object in Visual Guard then it executes the actions defined for this target to be executed when the security is loaded.
If some actions must be executed on other events, It handles these events. The actions associated to these events will be executed each time the events are raised.
remarks.para: If the target is an ancestor class, you must use the method to specify the type of the ancestor for which the security must be set.
remarks.b: For more information, you can consult:

para.A: How Visual Guard secures an application
How to apply security in your application

member.exception: is null.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityRuntime.SetSecurity(System.Object,System.Type)
member.summary: Sets the security corresponding to the specified type for the specified object.
member.param: The object for which you want to set the security
a object specifying the type for which the actions are targeted. This type must be assignable from the type of the specified object.

remarks.P: You need to call this method only once for each object instance.

In most of case, this method must be called at the end of constructor of the object (after the call of InitializeComponent method for components). This method registers the object in Visual Guard then it executes the actions defined for this target to be executed when the security is loaded.
If some actions must be executed on other events, It handles these events. The actions associated to these events will be executed each time the events are raised.
You can use this method when you define actions for an ancestor class. By default Visual Guard sets the security only for the type of the object and not for its ancestor.
remarks.b: For more information, you can consult:

para.A: How Visual Guard secures an application
How to apply security in your application

member.exception: or is null.
the type of is not a sub class of .

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityRuntime.LoadAnomymousSecurity(System.Security.Principal.IIdentity)
member.summary: Loads the permission for an anonymous session associated to the specified windows identity
member.param: the identity for which an anonymous session is loaded.
member.remarks:
The application supports the anonymous session when a role is specified as anonymous role for your applcation and the option anonymousSessionSupported of your Visual Guard configuration file is equal to true.
To define an anonymous role, you must be connected to the repository with the Visual Guard console and modify the property Anonymous Role of your application.
After modifying this property, you have to regenerate the Visual Guard configuration file of your application or edit it to modify the option anonymousSessionSupported.
member.exception: The application does not allowed anonymous session or the role granted to the anonymous session is not valid.

The configuration file is not valid
or A problem occurs during the connection to the repository.
or The version of the repository or the version of the permissions is not supported by the application.

member.name: M:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityRuntime.CheckContext(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Check if the context of Visual Guard is valid.
member.param: throw an error if the context is not valid
member.returns: true if the Visual Guard context is valid, false otherwise.
member.remarks: You can call this method if you want to check if the context of Visual Guard is valid for the application. If you do not call this method, Visual Guard will check this information at the first call of the repository and will throw an exception at this time. The method will check if Visual Guard configuration files are valid and if it is possible to access to the repository and if the application has enough permissions on this repository.
member.exception: This exception will be thrown if the application cannot access to the repository.
This exception will be thrown if Visual Guard configuration files are not available or if the parameters of these files are not valid.

member.name: P:Novalys.VisualGuard.Security.VGSecurityRuntime.IncludeWindowsGroups
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether role granted to Windows Groups are included to the list of role of a user.
member.returns: true if Windows groups are included; otherwise, false. The default is true.
member.remarks:
if the Windows groups are not required, setting this property to false can improve performance by avoiding to load role granted to Windows groups.
When the license stored in the repository does not supports Windows Groups, this option is ignored.
